extendedInfo.description: Use the free Beta version of Drugs.com Personal Medication Record (ePMR) to keep track of your medications and instantly assemble relevant medical information in a simple, easy to read personalized format. Gain immediate access to in-depth consumer information, drug comparisons, historical news, FDA alerts, drug interactions, plus food, allergy & medical condition interactions.

reviews.title: Brilliant
reviews.comment: Being a dental student now I hav pharmacology at my finger tip.
reviews.author: Sabahat Khan

reviews.comment: US drugs only
reviews.author: Richie Russ

reviews.title: Can\'t enter condition
reviews.comment: I find it upsetting I can\'t add my son\'s heart defect. He is my reasoning for downloading this app. Heart disease is entirely different than a heart defect which means this app is useless to me if it doesn\'t recognize his condition. Uninstalling and 1 and 125 children are born with heart defects.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.comment: This was perfect for I wanted and needed I recommend this program to anyone who go to the doctor and he ask what Med are you taking.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: why don\'t we have zero stars?
reviews.comment: slow. poor interface. deleted data from the information I setup on the web page when I tried to access it on my Galaxy S when I tried to view it.  can I have the 40 minutes I spent entering the data on their (incredibly slow) webpage back? don\'t waste your effort on this.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great Info...but
reviews.comment: I sat down and put all my info in this app for it not to be able to work withought wifi...too bad I found out trying to access it at my doctors office...I would have given it  a \"1\" star, but the accurate info did help me when a highly paid and respected  IDIOT Doctor game me Meds that could have killed me from a fatal interaction of the ones he already knew I was on,  because he gave me those as well...I suppose his mistress wanted a new Mercedes that weekend
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Simple and Easy
reviews.comment: What I was looking for - simple and easy - when I begin to type in my meds it pulls it up - you do have to put in your dosage. It would be nice if you just had to fill in the blanks for a dosage and how often you took it or have a drop down list.  The only other problem is that when you enter allergies it doesn\'t have a place to report the reactions caused by that particular medication.  But simple, easy and not too much extra stuff.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: 0 if I could
reviews.comment: Does nothing that it claims.   Filled with bad medicine recommendations and over generalized advice.   This app could actually harm the less educated.   Please remove.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: What I\'m looking for
reviews.comment: This app does what I had in mind for this kind of purpose. Some bugs though when it comes to saving content. HTC Evo 4G
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Slow, waste of time
reviews.comment: Big let down!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Lost my profile
reviews.comment: At a Dr. Appt and my list is lost. Did not save my information.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Buggy
reviews.comment: Issues sometimes when entering drugs, won\'t save all the time, box with type of units pops up for no reason, won\'t always let me click treatment details to enter new details and cannot change treatment details after entered, have to delete and add new if it lets u. Also after saving drug just stays on that screen, should take u back to main list and have option to save and add another. Needs lots of work already and that\'s as far as I got using app so far.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Editing med list didn\'t work well, messed up some entries I had entered from computer. Handy ref. Wish it worked better.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Sounds great,  looks great - doesn\'t work at all, just a message telling you it is loading, but never does anything else - uninstalled.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Potential
reviews.comment: Lots of potential but needs a lot of work. Running slow on GS2. Too slow to be of much use right now.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Record?
reviews.comment: There isn\'t any place to enter how much, when it was taken, or history. It is just a list of meds, nothing else.
reviews.author: Randy Smith

reviews.title: VERY BUGGY
reviews.comment: Just some examples: clearly designed for iOS; strange boxes won\'t let you press back button to close; needs \'no allergies\' option.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Cool.
reviews.comment: This works great and is very easy to use!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: poor
reviews.comment: loses the data I input randomly, freezes more often than not, laggy, and UI lacking on so many fronts.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Fantastic
reviews.author: A Google User
